intro: Baeckea calycina, commonly known as the pink baeckea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture and a fragrant scent. Baeckea calycina is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and dry environments.
